sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | मय्यासक्तमना: पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रय: | असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ||1||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
mayy āsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśhrayaḥ
asaṁśhayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tach chhṛiṇu
translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, hear how, with your mind attached to Me and practicing yoga under My protection, you can know Me completely and without doubt.

sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः | यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ||2||
transliteration:
jñānaṁ te ’haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣhyāmy aśheṣhataḥ
yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo ’nyaj jñātavyam avaśhiṣhyate
translation: I shall now reveal to you this knowledge and wisdom in full, knowing which nothing further shall remain to be known in this world.

sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये | यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ||3||
transliteration:
manuṣyāṇāṁ sahasreṣhu kaśchid yatati siddhaye
yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaśchin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ
translation: Among thousands of men, one may strive for perfection, and among those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.

sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च | अहंकार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ||4||
transliteration:
bhūmir āpo ’nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva cha
ahaṅkāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛitir aṣhṭadhā
translation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and ego—these eight constitute My separated material energies.

sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् | जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ||5||
transliteration:
apareyam itas tv anyāṁ prakṛitiṁ viddhi me parām
jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat
translation: Besides this inferior nature, O mighty-armed Arjuna, know that there is a superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who sustain the world.

sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय | अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ||6||
transliteration:
etad yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇīty upadhāraya
ahaṁ kṛitsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā
translation: Understand that all living beings are born from these two energies. I am the origin and the dissolution of the entire universe.

sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय | मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||7||
transliteration:
mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñchid asti dhanañjaya
mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva
translation: There is nothing higher than Me, O Dhananjaya. All beings are strung on Me like pearls on a thread.

sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः | प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ||8||
transliteration:
raso ’ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śhaśi-sūryayoḥ
praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣhu śhabdaḥ khe pauruṣhaṁ nṛiṣhu
translation: O son of Kunti, I am the taste in water, the light of the sun and the moon, the syllable Om in the Vedic mantras, the sound in ether, and the ability in humans.

sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ | जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ||9||
transliteration:
puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛithivyāṁ cha tejaśh chāsmi vibhāvasau
jīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu tapaśh chāsmi tapasviṣhu
translation: I am the pure fragrance of the earth and the brilliance in fire. I am the life in all living beings and the austerity of the ascetics.

sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् | बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ||10||
transliteration:
bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam
buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
translation: O Partha, know Me to be the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the intelligent and the brilliance of the brilliant.

sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् | धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ||11||
transliteration:
balaṁ balavatāṁ chāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam
dharmāviruddho bhūteṣhu kāmo ’smi bharatarṣhabha
translation: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of passion and desire. I am sex life which is not contrary to dharma, O best of the Bharatas.

sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये | मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ||12||
transliteration:
ye chaiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāśh cha ye
matta eveti tān viddhi na tv ahaṁ teṣhu te mayi
translation: Know that all states of being—goodness, passion, and ignorance—are manifested by My energy. I am not in them, but they are in Me.

sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् | मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ||13||
transliteration:
tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat
mohitaṁ nābhijānāti mām ebhyaḥ param avyayam
translation: Deluded by the three modes (gunas), the whole world does not know Me, who am beyond these modes and inexhaustible.

sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया | मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ||14||
transliteration:
daivī hyeṣhā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā
mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te
translation: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three gunas, is difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me can easily cross beyond it.

sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः | माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ||15||
transliteration:
na māṁ duṣkṛitino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ
māyayāpahṛita-jñānā āsuraṁ bhāvam āśhritāḥ
translation: The deluded, who are the lowest among men, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of the nature of demons, do not surrender unto Me.

sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन | आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ||16||
transliteration:
chatur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛitino ’rjuna
ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī cha bharatarṣhabha
translation: O Arjuna, four kinds of pious people engage in My devotion—the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise.

sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते | प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ||17||
transliteration:
teṣhāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśhiṣhyate
priyo hi jñānino ’tyartham ahaṁ sa cha mama priyaḥ
translation: Of these, the wise one who is ever steadfast and devoted to the One alone is the best. I am very dear to the wise, and they are dear to Me.

sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् | आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ||18||
transliteration:
udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam
āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim
translation: All these devotees are noble, but the wise one is My very Self. Being steadfast in devotion, he attains Me, the highest goal.

sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते | वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ||19||
transliteration:
bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate
vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ
translation: After many births, the wise one surrenders to Me, realizing that Vāsudeva is everything. Such a great soul is very rare.

sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः | तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ||20||
transliteration:
kāmais tais tair hṛita-jñānāḥ prapadyante ’nya-devatāḥ
taṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛityā niyatāḥ svayā
translation: Those whose knowledge is stolen by desires surrender to other gods, following various rules and rituals according to their own natures.

sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति | तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ||21||
transliteration:
yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śhraddhayārchitum ichchhati
tasya tasyāchalāṁ śhraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmy aham
translation: Whatever form a devotee desires to worship with faith, I make that faith steady in them.

sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते | लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ||22||
transliteration:
sa tayā śhraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate
labhate cha tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān
translation: Endowed with that faith, he worships that deity and obtains his desires, but these are actually granted by Me alone.

sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् | देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ||23||
transliteration:
antavat tu phalaṁ teṣhāṁ tad bhavaty alpa-medhasām
devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api
translation: The fruit gained by these people of small understanding is temporary. Worshippers of the gods go to the gods, but My devotees come to Me.

sanskrit: अविज्ञानन्तो मां मूढा मनुष्यं तनुमाश्रितम् | परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ||24||
transliteration:
avijānanto māṁ mūḍhā manuṣhyaṁ tanum āśhritam
paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśhvaram
translation: The ignorant think of Me, the Supreme Lord, as having assumed a human form. They do not know My higher nature, which is imperishable and supreme.

sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः | मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ||25||
transliteration:
nāhaṁ prakāśhaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛitaḥ
mūḍho ’yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam
translation: I am never manifest to the foolish and unintelligent. For them I am covered by My divine energy, and so they do not know that I am unborn and infallible.

sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन | भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ||26||
transliteration:
vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni chārjuna
bhaviṣhyāṇi cha bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaśhchana
translation: O Arjuna, I know all beings—past, present, and future—but no one knows Me in truth.

sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत | सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ||27||
transliteration:
ichchhā-dveṣha-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata
sarva-bhūtāni sammohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa
translation: O descendant of Bharata, all living beings are deluded at birth by the dualities arising from desire and aversion.

sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् | ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ||28||
transliteration:
yeṣhāṁ tv anta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām
te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛiḍha-vratāḥ
translation: But those whose sins are destroyed, who are engaged in virtuous deeds, and who are free from the delusion of dualities, worship Me with firm resolve.

sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये | ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ||29||
transliteration:
jarā-maraṇa-mokṣhāya mām āśhritya yatanti ye
te brahma tad viduḥ kṛitsnam adhyātmaṁ karma chākhilam
translation: Those who strive for liberation from old age and death, taking refuge in Me, know Brahman, the entire field of spiritual knowledge, and all actions.

sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः | प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ||30||
transliteration:
sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ cha ye viduḥ
prayāṇa-kāle ’pi cha māṁ te vidur yukta-chetasaḥ
translation: Those who know Me as the Supreme Being associated with the physical and divine realms, and as the Lord of all sacrifices, even at the time of death, their minds united with Me—they know Me truly.
